alert.note: Alert for Cottle; King (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 04 at 6:26PM CDT until May 04 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern King County in northwestern Texas... Southern Cottle County in northwestern Texas... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 625 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Delwin, or 12 miles south of Paducah, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Finney, Grow, Delwin, Chalk and Hackberry. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
